EEG Wave Changes: Alpha decreased.
Brain Functions: Odors produce divided attention even when undetected.

EEG Wave Changes: Alpha increased.
Brain Functions: Stimulating and excitatory effects.

Odorant Materials: Birch tar, galbanum, heliotropine, jasmine, lavender, lemon and peppermint
EEG Wave Changes: Increased theta for birch tar, jasmine, lavender and lemon.
Brain Functions: Subjects differed in their subjective responses to the odors.

Odorant Materials: 5-α-Androstan-3-one, bangalol, white sapphire, indole, linalyl acetate, eucalyptus oil and ammonia.
EEG Wave Changes: Alpha increased.
Brain Functions: From more anterior electrodes—related to psychometric responses.

EEG Wave Changes: Valeric acid—alpha 2 increased.
Brain Functions: Unpleasant odor leads to a cortical deactivation.

EEG Wave Changes: Lavender—beta increased. Rosemary—frontal alpha and beta decreased.
Brain Functions: Lavender—increased drowsiness. Rosemary—increased alertness.

Odorant Materials: Synthetic odors—almond, chocolate, spearmint, strawberry, vegetable, garlic, onion and cumin Odors of real foods—chocolate, baked beans and rotting pork
EEG Wave Changes: Chocolate odor—less theta activity.
Brain Functions: Reduced level of attention.

EEG Wave Changes: Alpha power increased.
Brain Functions: Arousal psychosomatic responses.

Odorant Materials: Valeriana off, Lavandula off, Passiflora incarnata, Piper methysticum, Melissa off, Eschscbolzia californica, Hypericum perforatum and Ginkgo biloba
EEG Wave Changes: Valerian extract—delta and theta activity increased and beta activity decreased.
Brain Functions: Self-rated tiredness increased under some of the plant extracts.

EEG Wave Changes: (RS)-(±)-linalool—greater decrease of the beta wave after work than before work.
Brain Functions: (RS)-(±)-linalool and (R)-(−)-linalool -favorable impression. (S)-(+)-linalool—unfavorable impression.

Odorant Materials: Chewing regular gum or gum base without flavor
EEG Wave Changes: Alpha-2 and beta-2 increased for regular gum and decreased for gum base.
Brain Functions: Activates different brain neuronal populations.

Odorant Materials: Sedative effects—lemon, lavender and sandalwood Awakening effects—jasmine, ylang-ylang, rose and peppermint
EEG Wave Changes: Awakening fragrances—decreased alpha and beta activities.
Brain Functions: Sedative fragrances—improvement in productivity.Awakening fragrances—effect in mitigating the workload.

EEG Wave Changes: Alpha 1 decreased at parietal and posterior temporal regions.
Brain Functions: Subjects felt comfortable.

Odorant Materials: Chewing gum with and without flavor and flavored aromatic oil
EEG Wave Changes: Chewing gum with flavor and inhale aromatic oil increase alpha and beta waves.
Brain Functions: Induce concentration with a harmonious high arousal state in brain function.

EEG Wave Changes: (R)-(−)-linalool—beta decreased after hearing environmental sound. Mental work—beta increased.
Brain Functions: Odor perception and responses—chiral dependence and also with task dependence.

Odorant Materials: Aroma of soybeans heated to various temperatures
EEG Wave Changes: Alpha wave increased—heated after immersion in fructose–glycine solution.
Brain Functions: Amino-carbonyl reaction aroma products increase brain alpha waves.

EEG Wave Changes: Non-significant trend for left frontal differences in EEG associated with different liking responses.
Brain Functions: Left frontal response associated with liking an odor.

EEG Wave Changes: Induce left frontal EEG shifting in adults and infants with greater baselines than right frontal EEG activation.
Brain Functions: Associated with greater approach behavior and less depressed affect.

Odorant Materials: General workers, perfume salespersons and professional perfume researchers
EEG Wave Changes: Professional perfume researchers respond to odors mainly in the frontal region.
Brain Functions: Functional coupling for people—occupationally exposed to odors may be related to psychological preference.

EEG Wave Changes: Increased relative left frontal EEG asymmetry.
Brain Functions: Infants of depressed and non-depressed mothers respond differently to odors.

EEG Wave Changes: Theta wave activation in frontal region between the different populations.
Brain Functions: Cultural differences in odor responsiveness.

EEG Wave Changes: Beta wave increased in the left frontal region.
Brain Functions: Enhancement of left frontal brain region by a pleasant odor.

EEG Wave Changes: Slow alpha (8–10 Hz) and theta activities increased in the occipital region.
Brain Functions: Reduce the cortical deactivation or promote a relaxed state.

EEG Wave Changes: Theta power decreased in both hemispheres in the high-dose condition.
Brain Functions: Corresponding to working memory demand.

Odorant Materials: Odor of incense and rose oil
EEG Wave Changes: Fast alpha activity increased in bilateral posterior regions during incense exposure.
Brain Functions: Cortical and function of inhibitory processing of motor response.

EEG Wave Changes: Negative percentage changes of the ratio of low to high frequency in the music, aroma and combined groups than control group.
Brain Functions: Listening to soft music and inhaling Citrus bergamia essential oil—effective method of relaxation.

EEG Wave Changes: Increased theta activity after the visual display terminal task.
Brain Functions: Prevention of visual display terminal—mental health disturbance.

EEG Wave Changes: Good sleep quality—occipital and parietal alpha decreased, frontal theta and occipital beta increased. Poor sleep quality—theta increased in the all cranial regions.
Brain Functions: Beneficial effect for female adults with sleep disorder.

EEG Wave Changes: Theta and alpha activities increased.
Brain Functions: Relaxing effect of inhaling lavender oil.

Odorant Materials: Essential oil of Zizyphus jujuba seeds
EEG Wave Changes: Fast alpha increased in the left prefrontal, right prefrontal and left frontal regions.
Brain Functions: Increasing attention and relaxation.

Odorant Materials: Essential oil of Mentha arvensis L. f. piperascens aerial parts
EEG Wave Changes: Relative fast alpha increased. Gamma and the spectral edge frequency 90% decreased.
Brain Functions: Reducing mental stress.

EEG Wave Changes: Beta wave increased in the anterior center and left posterior regions.
Brain Functions: Increased—feeling of well-being, active, fresh and romantic.

EEG Wave Changes: Prolonged the latencies of P300
Brain Functions: Not affect information processing resources in patients with TLE.

Odorant Materials: Essential odors—mint and lemon Commerical odors—criton-verbena, lize, melody and rozan
EEG Wave Changes: All odors affected the EEG waves in at least some subjects.
Brain Functions: Essential odors stimulated more than commercial odors and women are more sensitive than men.

Odorant Materials: Pan-fired Japanese green tea (Koushun and Kouju)
EEG Wave Changes: Kouju affect the beta 1 at right frontal region.
Brain Functions: Improve memory task performance.

EEG Wave Changes: Absolute alpha decreased at left parietal region.
Brain Functions: Awaken and increase the concentration states of brain.

Odorant Materials: Strawberry aroma (food) and the odor of lily of the valley (non-food)
EEG Wave Changes: Specific scalp potential maps for the two conditions.
Brain Functions: Food odor—associated with the processing of rewards. Non-food odor—reflects odor characteristics excluding the reward.

EEG Wave Changes: Fast delta decreased and alpha increased in the posterior regions.
Brain Functions: Oxygen-toxicity diving-related problems.

EEG Wave Changes: Theta showed statistically significant results between different odor conditions
Brain Functions: Stimuli can affect the frequency characteristics of the electrical activity of the brain.

EEG Wave Changes: (+)-Limonene—relative high beta increased in the right temporal region. Terpinolene—relative mid beta decreased and relative fast alpha increased in the right prefrontal region.
Brain Functions: Terpinolene—reducing the tension and increasing the relaxation and stabilization states of brain function.

Odorant Materials: Essential oil of Inula helenium root
EEG Wave Changes: Theta (in all the regions except T3), beta (Fp1) and mid beta (P4) and relative theta (Fp1, Fp2, F3 and F4) decreased.
Brain Functions: Enhance the alertness state of brain.

EEG Wave Changes: The absolute theta increased at the right prefrontal region Significant differences in the relative fast and slow alpha.
Brain Functions: Both physical and mental states became more stable and relaxed.
